title: 'Macron's brutal dissolution of the Assemblée resulted in the dissolution of his majority'
summary: By deciding to call early elections, the French president caused the destruction of his own majority and, therefore, his own weakening for the next three years, writes Le Monde's Solenn de Royer.

title: French elections: The urgent need to block the far right
summary: There are just six days left to prevent the far right from gaining an absolute majority in the Assemblée Nationale. Only a strong republican front, uniting the left, center and conservatives, can keep the far right at bay and prevent France from tipping over.

title: Macron's coalition split over how to block far right
summary: Prime Minister Gabriel Attal said there was a 'moral duty' to prevent the far-right Rassemblement National from having an absolute majority, suggesting the presidential coalition's third-placed candidates should withdraw. Some in Macron's camp don't agree.

title: French elections: Mixed feelings for left-wing alliance
summary: Having come second in the first round, the left-wing alliance Nouveau Front Populaire goes into the second round united, and ready to support the rival candidates if it means beating the far-right Rassemblement National. But the lack of reciprocity from the right and Macron's camp weakens it.

title: French elections: World leaders react to far-right surge
summary: From the UK to Russia and Spain, world leaders had different reactions to the results of the first round of snap elections that saw the far right achieve a historic score.

title: French elections: Far right, euphoric at historic score, verges on seizing power
summary: Far-right leader Jordan Bardella confirmed that he would only accept being named prime minister if he obtains an absolute majority at the Assemblée Nationale. Yet both he and Marine Le Pen know they will need to rally beyond their ranks.

title: Euro 2024: Portugal beat Slovenia on penalties to reach quarter-finals
summary: Portugal will face France on Friday in Hamburg, a rematch of the 2016 final that Portugal won in Paris.

title: US Supreme Court sends Trump's immunity case back to lower court, delaying trial
summary: The court ruled that while a president is immune from criminal prosecution for 'official acts' taken in office, he is not immune for 'unofficial acts,' and ordered lower courts to figure out precisely how to apply the decision to Trump's case.

title: In the United Kingdom, the future government will lack budgetary leeway
summary: While polls predict a left-wing victory in the July 4 general election, the British Labour Party is shying away from grand promises, due to high debt and sluggish growth.

title: Ford goes all-in on electric vehicles
summary: The American automaker, no longer able to find its feet on the European market, has decided to break away from combustion engine models but has not yet fully established its position.

title: France edge tense clash with Belgium to reach Euro 2024 quarter-finals
summary: An own goal from Belgium gave France the win as they edged Belgium 1-0 in a tense tie in Düsseldorf. Les Bleus will play Portugal in the last eight in Hamburg on Friday.

title: Anatomy of an Israeli disinformation campaign
summary: Benjamin Netanyahu's government has financed an anti-Palestinian smear campaign targeting Jewish, African-American and progressive audiences in the US, writes columnist Jean-Pierre Filiu.

title: Girmay dedicates Tour stage win to Africa as Carapaz takes lead
summary: Eritrean Biniam Girmay described himself as the 'first Black African to win at the Tour' while Richard Carapaz took the overall cycling race lead in Turin.

title: At Hellfest, extreme music opens up to mainstream rock
summary: Closing the festival on Sunday night, the Foo Fighters, as well as Metallica, Mass Hysteria and Mr. Bungle, left their mark on the 17th edition of the French festival.

title: Ismail Kadare, the great Albanian writer, dies aged 88
summary: He was one of the few Albanian authors known and translated worldwide. He died on Monday in Tirana.

title: French elections: PM suspends divisive unemployment insurance reform
summary: Contested by both opposition parties and workers' unions, the reform was supposed to be implemented by decree on July 1 and lead to €3.6 billion in savings per year.

title: Simone Biles seals Paris Olympics spot: 'I'm so glad that I never gave up'
summary: The 27-year-old US gymnast secured an automatic place for Paris 2024 Games in Minnesota on Sunday, it will be her third Olympics.

title: Trump ally Steve Bannon surrenders to federal prison to serve 4-month sentence on contempt charges
summary: Bannon had defied a subpoena in the congressional investigation into the January 6 US Capitol attack.

title: Wimbledon 2024: Sabalenka withdraws with injury, first match won by France's Gracheva
summary: The former world number one announced her withdrawal on Monday, paving the way for Russian lucky loser Erika Andreeva to take her place in the first round.

title: How Macron is preparing for 'cohabitation' with the far right
summary: Even before the French cast their final votes in the elections, the president began planning in case he has to share power with the Rassemblement National. He is speeding up key appointments while he still has control of the government.

title: Between Mexico and Texas, the despair of migrants dependent on the US election
summary: The area occupied by illegal immigrants seeking to reach the United States illegally has been emptying since June 4, when Joe Biden issued an executive order to close the border in the event of an influx.

title: Air France says Olympics cut summer tourists to Paris
summary: The airline warned on Monday that there was evidence of 'a significance avoidance of Paris' and that many French were also postponing their holidays.

title: 39 killed in Kenya anti-tax protests says National Commission on Human Rights
summary: A further 361 were reported injured in the anti-government protests that erupted last month over planned tax hikes.

title: Caribbean countries brace for powerful Hurricane Beryl
summary: Hurricane Beryl, a Category 3 storm that formed early in the June-November Atlantic hurricane season, has been sighted about 175 kilometers southeast of Barbados, which is one of the many Caribbean island nations preparing for the storm's passage.

title: Political scientist Bruno Cautrès: 'For the first time in its history, the RN has won the first round of a decisive election'
summary: The profound rejection of the government, public misunderstanding of the reasons behind the dissolution of the Assemblée Nationale and Emmanuel Macron's lack of political flair explain the presidential bloc's failure, writes the researcher.

title: How working conditions weigh on electoral choices
summary: The deterioration of working conditions is a determining factor in abstention and the protest vote, according to experts and French voters Le Monde spoke to over the last few years.

title: French public broadcasting targeted by RN threat of privatization
summary: The Rassemblement National may find it difficult to privatize public broadcasting, as it said it intends to do if it comes to power. But its demolition project has already begun.

title: French elections: Far-right vote is a long-delayed effect of jihadist terrorist attacks
summary: The Rassemblement National's possible rise to power could bring a process begun by France's terrorist attacks to fruition, driving people who have been stigmatized for years into jihadist movements' clutches.

title: French snap elections: Foreign press acknowledges 'the end of the Macron era'
summary: The international media fear that the far-right's accession to the premiership will destabilize France and erode its credit rating, and also that the turbulent aftershocks will weaken the European Union.

title: Two French filmmakers held for questioning over sexual abuse allegations
summary: Benoît Jacquot et Jacques Doillon, accused of sexual abuse by actors including Judith Godrèche, were held in police custody for questioning.

title: French elections: How many candidates have withdrawn from the second round?
summary: Le Monde has so far counted 190 candidates who have withdrawn from the second round, most of them in order to help beat the far-right Rassemblement National. The deadline to maintain candidacies in the second round is at 8 pm on Tuesday.

title: Supreme Court hands Trump big win on presidential immunity
summary: Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson, who opposed the decision, accused the Court's conservative majority of planting 'the seeds of absolute power' for presidents. Joe Biden denounced a 'dangerous precedent,' as the threat of a January 6 trial before the November election receded.

title: 'Inaudible' Macron faces cacophony in his own camp ahead of election's second round
summary: The French president castigated 'any form of disunity' but did not settle disagreements within his coalition on how to best block the far right and what to do after the elections, when he will be deprived of a majority.

title: Hungary's Orbán makes first visit to Ukraine since start of war
summary: The Hungarian prime minister arrived in Kyiv on Tuesday to talk with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, marking his first visit to the wartorn country since the start of Russia's invasion.

title: Hurricane Beryl strengthens to 'potentially catastrophic' Category 5 storm
summary: Hurricane Beryl battered islands in the southeastern Caribbean in what is now the earliest category 5 storm in the Atlantic on record.

title: French elections: Far-right candidate to withdraw after Nazi cap picture emerges
summary: Rassemblement National candidate Ludivine Daoudi is expected to withdraw from the second round of the parliamentary elections after a photo of her wearing a Nazi cap circulated on social media.

title: Le Pen accuses Macron of 'administrative coup d'état' as he speeds up appointments
summary: The president approved a series of appointments at the last Council of Ministers. The far-right Rassemblement National leader said the move was designed to 'prevent Jordan Bardella from governing the country as he wishes.'

title: Israel frees director of Gaza hospital, sparking internal political backlash
summary: The Palestinian doctor, who said he was subjected to 'severe torture' during his detention, was released after the Shin Bet confirmed that he met the criteria for release. Other sources indicate that the release of dozens of prisoners was due in part to a lack of space in Israeli prisons.

title: UK general election: Nigel Farage campaigns on fear of migrants as he looks to win first Commons seat
summary: The leader of the right-wing populist Reform UK party is standing in the general election on July 4, representing a deprived Essex constituency, Clacton-on-Sea.

title: Dutch king swears in a new government 7 months after far right won elections
summary: Dick Schoof, former head of the Dutch intelligence agency and counterterrorism office, signed the official royal decree at Huis Ten Bosch Palace on Tuesday.

title: French rappers release 'No Pasarán' in stand against the far right
summary: A 10-minute clip features 20 rappers of different generations, set to archival footage. Its tone is angry, the lyrics often excessive, insulting, and, at times, misogynistic or promoting conspiracy theories, which risks muddying their message.

title: Beatings, electric shocks, dog attacks: Ukrainians recount hell of Russian prisons
summary: Former prisoners of war, freed in an exchange, told Le Monde about the violence and degrading treatment they suffered during their time in prison.

title: Nearly 100 killed in stampede at India religious gathering
summary: Crowds had gathered to celebrate the Hindu deity Shiva in the city of Hathras, located some 140 kilometers southeast of New Delhi. Official reports reported the death toll had reached 97 on Tuesday afternoon.

title: Pompidou museum's planned New Jersey branch suspended
summary: The Paris-based art institution, known for its colorful and tubular building, was due to open a branch in Jersey City in the suburbs of New York in 2027.

title: Category 5 Hurricane Beryl kills 5, hurtles toward  Jamaica
summary: The storm is causing widespread destruction in a deadly sweep across the southeastern Caribbean.
